Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

Class OnPremiseAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.OnPremiseAuthenticator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable, IAuthenticator, IMfaAuthenticator
    public class OnPremiseAuthenticator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMfaAuthenticator
    This class holds the attributes for an authenticator for IBM Security Verify Access.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Version:
    2.0.3

                                   SubType subType)
        Description copied from interface: IAuthenticator
        Returns the keyName for the given SubType.

        The key name is the identifier of the authenticator (from IAuthenticator.getIdentifier(), concatenated with the string representation of the sub type.

        Specified by:
        getKeyName in interface IAuthenticator
        Specified by:
        getKeyName in interface IMfaAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        subType - the sub type of the requested key name
        Returns:
        if sub type is not null - the name of the key
        otherwise - an empty string

      • getQrLoginUri

public java.lang.String getQrLoginUri()

        Returns:
        the qrlogin_uri of the authenticator if stored previously
        an empty string otherwise
        Since:
        2.0.3

      • getDetailsUri

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String getDetailsUri()
        Returns the details_uri of the authenticator. That is, where the other endpoints and metadata got looked-up from. We need to store the details_uri, because it is our identifier for an authenticator in the QR login scenario (see OnPremiseQRLoginScan.
        Returns:
        the detail_uri of the authenticator if stored previously
        an empty string otherwise
        Since:
        2.0.3

      • describeContents

        public int describeContents()
        Specified by:
        describeContents in interface android.os.Parcelable

      • isIgnoreSsl

        public boolean isIgnoreSsl()
        Returns a flag indicating whether customized SSL checks should be enforced. These can be set via NetworkHandler.setOnPremiseSslParameter(SSLContext, TrustManager, HostnameVerifier) and will be used when calling NetworkHandler.getOnPremiseAPI(boolean) with this flag as the parameter.

        CAUTION: this should not be used in production environment!

        Returns:
        true if SSL checks should be ignored
        false otherwise

      • setIgnoreSSL

        public void setIgnoreSSL​(boolean ignoreSSL)
